item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1673; 08:41PM; 1446 W 66th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3gaiUWa; Harvard Park; KNOCKDOWN: 18 firefighters extinguished the fire in the detached garage in 16 minutes, preventing extension to the exposed structure. No injuries reported. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E233 E57 E66 RA33 T33; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1673; 08:25PM; 1429 W 67th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Opf08F; Harvard Park; One story, detached garage with fire showing and exposing another structure. Structure Fire; INC#1429; 05:36PM; 441 S Oxford Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3AiwyNO; Koreatown; Two story, craftsman-style single family dwelling (vacant) with heavy fire showing. The fire appears to be in the 2nd story/attic. Firefighters are in offensive mode (interior fire attack only, no vertical ventilation required).; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E226 E229 E52 RA6 T26 T29; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

Brush Fire - Assisting Agency; INC#1277; 04:14PM; 12965 Little Tujunga Canyon,Rd In Laco; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ObQg3f; Lake View Terrace; LAFD responded to the shooting range area on Little Tujunga with Angeles National Forest (ANF) @angeles_NF and @LACoFDPIO to approximately 1 acre mulch pile burning in low wind with a slow rate of spread in the Federal Response Area (FRA). All LAFD Air Operations resources are being released in addition to some LAFD ground resources. This is an ANF incident and all questions are referred to their agency. No further updates will be provided.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC12 BP74 CM40 CM42 DZ11 DZ12 E24 E274 E275 E289 E290 E298 E75 E77 E89 EM14 H1 H3 H4 H5 HA1 HA3 HA4 HA5 HE2 RA90 T74 T75 T89 T90 T98 WT77; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 11/14/2022 INC#1546

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1546; 06:59PM; 268 S Los Angeles St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DKSPWN; #DowntownLA; Firefighters entered the two-story commercial to find a contents fire on the first floor in dense storage conditions, with slight extension into the second floor. There were security measures to overcome in accessing the second floor, and smoke filled the entire building, challenging visibility. It took 49 firefighters 34 minutes to extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E10 E202 E203 E209 E3 E4 EA1 EM1 RA10 RA11 RA809 SQ21 T2 T3 T9; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1546; 06:25PM; 268 S Los Angeles St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DKSPWN; #Downtown; Two-story commercial building with contents fire on the first floor, and smoke throughout both floors. Offensive mode.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E209 E4 RA10 RA809 SQ21 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Multi-Patient Injury; INC#1573; 08:20PM; 3830 S Trinity St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3E0XjHz; Historic South-Central; A vehicle was reported to have driven through a street carnival. Six patients injured (all between 30 - 50 years old) and were evaluated and transported to area hospitals. Specific conditions are unavailable, but all were non-life-threatening injuries. LAPD Inc #3482. Nothing further.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E221 E46 EM1 EM13 EM9 RA14 RA15 RA21 RA246 RA33 RA809 RA810 RA814 RA833 RA834 T21; CH4; 15; Nicholas Prange
